subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: Specialised form of {{zh-l|性}}: “human nature; what is inborn” > “surname; clan name”.

subSections.title: Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かばね}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=かばね|-}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR"/>

Ultimate derivation unclear.  Some theories derive this as a Japanese compound of {{m|ja|株||tr=kabu|[[stock]], [[root]]}} + {{m|ja|根||tr=ne|[[root]], [[origin]]}} or {{m|ja|名||tr=na|[[name]]}}.  However, the required {{IPAchar|/u/}} → {{IPAchar|/a/}} sound shift would be unusual.

Another thought is that this might be a borrowing from, or somehow otherwise related to, {{cog|ko|골품}}, a Sino-Korean term also spelled {{m|ko|骨品|lit=[[bone]]s + [[goods]]}}, the name for a kind of kinship hierarchy that was prevalent in the {{w|Silla}} kingdom.  This latter theory and its related “bone” sense might also account for the [[homophony]] with {{m|ja|屍||tr=kabane|[[corpse]], [[dead]] [[body]]}}.

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|せい}}

From {{bor|ja|ltc|sort=せい|-}} {{ltc-l|姓}}.  The ''[[漢音#Japanese|kan'on]]'', so likely a later borrowing.  Compare modern {{cog|nan|-}} reading ''sèⁿ''.

subSections.title: Idioms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|姓を冒す|せい を おかす}}: to be [[adopt]]ed by a different [[clan]]; to take on a different [[surname]]
